docs.lead_paragraph: We observe that notice has been given in the U. S. Senate, of a bill for the better protection and greater comfort, of Emigrants in vessels on their way to the United States. We trust that some efficient action will be had upon this subject.
docs.snippet: We observe that notice has been given in the U. S. Senate, of a bill for the better protection and greater comfort, of Emigrants in vessels on their way to the United States. We trust that some efficient action will be had upon this subject.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; Arrival of the America at Halifax.. RESIGNATION OF THE RUSSELL MINISTRY. INTENSE EXCITEMENT IN ENGLAND. ALL QUIET IN FRANCE COTTON ACTIVE. By Telegraph over the Nova Scotia, New-Brunswick and Maine Lines to Portland, AND THENCE BY THE BAIN MERCHANTS' LINE TO NEW-YORK. ENGLAND. FRANCE. SPAIN AND PORTIGUAL. ITALY. BELGIUM. THE MARKETS. London Money Market American Sccurities. Hollingshed--Tetley & Co,'s Circalar, Feb. 20. Passengers.

docs.lead_paragraph: The R. M. steamship America, from Liverpool, Saturday afternoon, Feb. 21, arrived here last night, but, owing to tile state of the telegraph line, it was found impossible to communicate with Boston until a late hour this forenoon.
docs.snippet: The R. M. steamship America, from Liverpool, Saturday afternoon, Feb. 21, arrived here last night, but, owing to tile state of the telegraph line, it was found impossible to communicate with Boston until a late hour this forenoon.

docs.lead_paragraph: The extortions to which the poorer classes of our City are subjected, in regard to rents, are unjust and oppressive. Those who have not examined the matter know little of the enormous prices they are made to pay, and of the inconveniences to which they are still exposed.

headline.main: XXXIId CONGRESS.....First Session.; SENATE. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES. NEW-YORK LEGISLATURE. ASSEMBLY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The SENATE commenced business at 12 1/2 o' clock. PETITIONS. Several petitions in favor of and against the extension of WOODWORTH'S patent were presented; also, petitions against the renewal of McCORMICK'S patent for reaping machines. Mr. JONES presented a petition in favor of a line of steamers from New-York to Gatway, Ireland.

headline.main: Nathaniel P. Willis vs. Edwin Forrest.

docs.lead_paragraph: SUPERIOR COURT-Before Judge BOSWORTH. Second Day.-The Court and Jury assembled at 10 o'clock, the parties and their respective counsel being present. There was a large attendance of spectators, as usual at all exciting trials. The Court called upon Mr. Edward Sandford to proceed.

docs.lead_paragraph: GENTLEMEN: I have the pleasure to acknowLedge the recent of your invitation to the Congressional Banquet in honor of the birthday of Washington, to be served at Willard's Hotel, this day. Nothing would be more gratifying to me than to be able to assist on that distinguished occasion; but I regret to say, that the feeble state of my health will not allow me that satisfaction.
